newsitem.title: INDIA: India metals ranged on low demand, few arrivals.
newsitem.headline: India metals ranged on low demand, few arrivals.

text.p: Base metals were ranged on the local market on Wednesday, dealers said.
"Demand from industrial buyers remained at a low ebb but restricted arrivals kept prices quiet," one dealer said.

Sentiment was slightly firmer on reports of a recovery in the world market. Ready copper was steady at 11,850 rupees per quintal, after falling 50 rupees on Saturday. Markets were shut to mark festivals on Monday and Tuesday.
Zinc was quiet at 6,325 rupees and lead at 5,000 rupees per quintal in nominal trade. Nickel was steady at 39,300 rupees per quintal, as was tin at 35,900 rupees quintal.
